leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 生信-系统发育与进化生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 比对→建树→模型选择→比较分析→可视化

queries: [WEB] fast maximum likelihood tree builder github

tools.name: NestedBD
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST 2 package for Nested Birth-Death models in phylodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A package for the BEAST 2 platform that implements Nested Birth-Death models, allowing for the inference of hierarchical population dynamics from phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: GToTree
tools.one_line_profile: User-friendly workflow for phylogenomics from genomes to trees
tools.detailed_description: A workflow that automates the process of generating phylogenomic trees from a set of genomes. It handles gene search, alignment, concatenation, and tree inference.

tools.name: pipesnake
tools.one_line_profile: Best-practice analysis pipeline for phylogenomic reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow-based bioinformatics pipeline for phylogenomic reconstruction starting from short-read sequencing data, ensuring reproducibility and scalability.

tools.name: BEASTLabs
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of experimental and useful tools for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: A package for BEAST 2 that implements various experimental features, utilities, and models that are not yet part of the core distribution.

tools.name: bModelTest
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian model test package for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST 2 package that performs Bayesian model averaging over site models, allowing for simultaneous inference of the substitution model and the phylogeny.

tools.name: substmodels
tools.one_line_profile: Standard substitution models for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: A package containing standard nucleotide and amino acid substitution models for use with the BEAST 2 phylogenetic software.

tools.name: BEAST 2
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Evolutionary Analysis by Sampling Trees
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform program for Bayesian analysis of molecular sequences using MCMC. It estimates rooted, time-measured phylogenies using a wide range of models.

tools.name: PHACT
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogeny workflow for batch submission to HPC clusters
tools.detailed_description: A workflow designed for submitting batch phylogeny tasks to HPC clusters using the Slurm queue manager, facilitating large-scale phylogenetic analyses.

tools.name: EvoX
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed GPU-Accelerated Framework for Evolutionary Computation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library and framework for evolutionary algorithms and benchmark problems, leveraging JAX for GPU acceleration and distributed computing. Useful for scientific optimization problems.

tools.name: phyx
tools.one_line_profile: Command-line tools for phylogenetic data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A collection of command-line tools for performing various operations on phylogenetic trees and sequence alignments, such as conversion, filtering, and analysis.

tools.name: WhereDoGGo
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for prokaryotic phylogenomics and tree placement
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics pipeline designed for prokaryotic phylogenomics, allowing users to place new genomes onto the tree of life.

tools.name: MrBayes
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference of phylogeny
tools.detailed_description: A program for Bayesian inference and model choice across a wide range of phylogenetic and evolutionary models. It uses Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods.

tools.name: contacTrees
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST 2 package for inferring ancestral conversion graphs
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST 2 package designed for language phylogenetics, specifically for inferring ancestral conversion graphs to model contact and borrowing between languages.

tools.name: MAPLE
tools.one_line_profile: Approximate maximum likelihood phylogenetics at short divergence
tools.detailed_description: A new approximate approach for maximum likelihood phylogenetics, optimized for analyzing sequences with short divergence times.

tools.name: snpick
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and memory-efficient SNP extraction tool
tools.detailed_description: A Rust-based tool for extracting SNPs from large genomic alignments with minimal RAM usage and high performance, suitable for phylogenomic preprocessing.

tools.name: FASconCAT
tools.one_line_profile: Sequence concatenation tool for phylogenetic analysis
tools.detailed_description: A software that concatenates different kinds of sequence data (FASTA, PHYLIP, CLUSTAL) into supermatrix files for phylogenetic programs like RAxML or MrBayes.

tools.name: sondovac
tools.one_line_profile: Probe design script for target enrichment
tools.detailed_description: A script to create orthologous low-copy nuclear probes from transcriptome and genome skim data for target enrichment in phylogenomics.

tools.name: ExaBayes
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale Bayesian phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: A software package for Bayesian phylogenetic inference, specifically designed for large-scale datasets and high-performance computing environments (HPC).

tools.name: beast2-xml
tools.one_line_profile: Python code to generate BEAST2 XML files
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility for programmatically generating XML configuration files for BEAST 2, facilitating the automation of phylogenetic analysis setups.

tools.name: PhyloM
tools.one_line_profile: Tumor Phylogeny Topology Inference via Deep Learning
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based tool for inferring the topology of tumor phylogenies, applying phylogenetic methods to cancer evolution.

tools.name: RAxML-NG
tools.one_line_profile: Next-generation phylogenetic tree inference tool using Maximum Likelihood
tools.detailed_description: RAxML-NG is a phylogenetic tree inference tool which uses the Maximum Likelihood (ML) criterion. It offers improved speed, flexibility, and scalability compared to the original RAxML, supporting a wide range of evolutionary models and data types.

tools.name: beast2_constsites
tools.one_line_profile: Utility script to update BEAST2 XML configuration for constant sites
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility designed to modify BEAST2 XML input files to correctly account for constant sites (invariant sites) in phylogenetic analysis, which is crucial for accurate branch length and clock rate estimation.

tools.name: Whale.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian gene tree reconciliation and Whole Genome Duplication inference
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for Bayesian inference of gene tree reconciliation and Whole Genome Duplication (WGD) events using Amalgamated Likelihood Estimation (ALE).

tools.name: PhylogenomicsPipelines
tools.one_line_profile: Pipelines for performing phylogenomic analysis
tools.detailed_description: A collection of pipelines designed to automate steps in phylogenomic analysis, facilitating the processing of genomic data for evolutionary studies.

tools.name: PhyloBayes
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian phylogenetic reconstruction using infinite mixtures
tools.detailed_description: A Bayesian Monte Carlo Markov Chain (MCMC) sampler for phylogenetic reconstruction using protein or nucleic acid alignments. It implements non-parametric methods (CAT and CAT-GTR models) for modeling site-specific evolutionary processes.

tools.name: BEAST
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Evolutionary Analysis Sampling Trees
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform program for Bayesian analysis of molecular sequences using MCMC. It is oriented towards rooted, time-measured phylogenies inferred using strict or relaxed molecular clock models.

tools.name: PhyloPhlAn
tools.one_line_profile: Precise phylogenetic analysis of microbial isolates and metagenomes
tools.detailed_description: An integrated pipeline for large-scale phylogenetic profiling of genomes and metagenomes. It uses identifying markers to reconstruct high-resolution phylogenies for microbial isolates.

tools.name: EMPress
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and scalable phylogenetic tree viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based phylogenetic tree viewer designed to handle large trees (hundreds of thousands of tips) and integrate with microbiome data analysis platforms like QIIME 2.

tools.name: Delphy
tools.one_line_profile: Fast, scalable, accurate and accessible Bayesian phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A software package for Bayesian phylogenetic inference, designed to be fast and scalable, utilizing modern algorithmic approaches for estimating evolutionary trees.

tools.name: A-pro
tools.one_line_profile: ASTRAL for PaRalogs and Orthologs
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the ASTRAL method designed to handle both paralogs and orthologs for species tree estimation, improving accuracy in the presence of gene duplication and loss.

tools.name: ASTER
tools.one_line_profile: Accurate Species Tree EstimatoR family of algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A suite of optimization algorithms for species tree inference, including fast and scalable implementations like ASTRAL-Pro 3 and CASTER, designed for large-scale phylogenomics.

tools.name: cogent3
tools.one_line_profile: Comparative Genomics Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for genomic sequence analysis and comparative genomics, providing tools for controlling process calculators, manipulating sequences, and performing phylogenetic analyses.

tools.name: sprspace
tools.one_line_profile: Quantifying MCMC exploration of tree space
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts for analyzing the exploration of Subtree Prune-and-Regraft (SPR) tree space within MrBayes posterior distributions, useful for assessing MCMC convergence and mixing in phylogenetics.

tools.name: SNPPar
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel and Homoplasic SNP Finder
tools.detailed_description: A tool for finding homoplasic SNPs and performing parallel evolution analysis from phylogenetic trees and alignment data.

tools.name: MPBoot
tools.one_line_profile: Fast phylogenetic maximum parsimony tree inference and bootstrap
tools.detailed_description: A software for fast and accurate maximum parsimony tree inference and bootstrap approximation, suitable for large-scale phylogenetic datasets.

tools.name: PhyloSuite
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated platform for molecular sequence data management and phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A desktop platform that integrates various bioinformatics tools to streamline the workflow of molecular sequence data management, alignment, and evolutionary phylogenetic studies.

tools.name: PhyloSD
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenomic Subgenome Detection pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for detecting subgenomes in allopolyploids using phylogenomic approaches, facilitating the study of polyploid evolution.

tools.name: treedater
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable relaxed clock phylogenetic dating
tools.detailed_description: An R package for estimating molecular clock dates on phylogenetic trees, supporting relaxed clock models and scalable to large viral phylogenies.

tools.name: modeltest_phylo
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for phylogenetic model selection and reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A shell-based pipeline that combines tools for evolutionary model selection (jModelTest, ProtTest), phylogenetic reconstruction (PhyML, RAxML), and topology comparison.

tools.name: trisicell
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable tumor phylogeny inference from single-cell data
tools.detailed_description: A computational toolkit for scalable inference and validation of tumor phylogenies using single-cell RNA or DNA sequencing data.

tools.name: HomBlocks
tools.one_line_profile: Multiple-alignment construction pipeline for organelle phylogenomics
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to construct multiple alignments for organelle phylogenomics by searching for locally collinear blocks, facilitating evolutionary studies of chloroplasts and mitochondria.

tools.name: POTION
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for positive Darwinian selection detection
tools.detailed_description: An end-to-end pipeline for detecting positive Darwinian selection in genome-scale data by performing phylogenetic comparison of protein-coding genes.

tools.name: CAFE5
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Analysis of gene Family Evolution (version 5)
tools.detailed_description: Software for the statistical analysis of the evolution of the size of gene families. It uses a birth and death process to model gene gain and loss across a phylogenetic tree.

tools.name: trimAl
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for automated alignment trimming in phylogenetic analyses
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the automated removal of spurious sequences or poorly aligned regions from a multiple sequence alignment, improving the quality of subsequent phylogenetic reconstruction.

tools.name: IQ-TREE 2
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient software for phylogenetics using maximum likelihood
tools.detailed_description: The second version of IQ-TREE, a fast and effective stochastic algorithm to infer phylogenetic trees by maximum likelihood. It supports complex models of sequence evolution and provides fast bootstrap approximation.

tools.name: IQ-TREE 3
tools.one_line_profile: Next version of IQ-TREE for phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: The development version (v3) of the IQ-TREE software for phylogenetic inference, continuing to provide efficient maximum likelihood tree estimation.

tools.name: teiphy
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for TEI XML collations to phylogenetic formats
tools.detailed_description: A tool for converting textual collation data (in TEI XML format) into formats suitable for phylogenetic analysis (NEXUS, BEAST XML), enabling the application of phylogenetic methods to stemmatology and textual criticism.

tools.name: Orthoscope
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic web tool for phylogenetic inference of orthogroups
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool designed for the automatic phylogenetic inference of animal and plant orthogroups, facilitating targeted taxonomic sampling and evolutionary analysis.

tools.name: AMPHORA
tools.one_line_profile: Automated phylogenomic inference pipeline for bacterial sequences
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for automated phylogenomic inference, designed to identify and align protein-coding genes from metagenomic or genomic datasets for phylogenetic analysis.

tools.name: PhyloHerb
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenomic analysis pipeline for herbarium specimens
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to process high-throughput sequencing data from herbarium specimens for phylogenomic analysis, handling low-quality DNA typical of such samples.

tools.name: Evolutionary-Rates-Analysis-Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for large scale phylogenetics comparisons using BOLD data
tools.detailed_description: R-based software pipelines to perform large scale phylogenetics comparisons of various taxa found on the Barcode of Life Database (BOLD) API.

tools.name: Phyla
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation model for phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: A foundation model approach towards phylogenetic inference, leveraging deep learning to estimate phylogenetic relationships from sequence data.

tools.name: TREE-QMC
tools.one_line_profile: Quartet-based species tree estimation algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A scalable algorithm for estimating species trees and trees of blobs from gene trees using quartet-based methods, suitable for handling gene tree discordance.

tools.name: FastTree
tools.one_line_profile: Approximately-maximum-likelihood phylogenetic trees for large alignments
tools.detailed_description: FastTree infers approximately-maximum-likelihood phylogenetic trees from alignments of nucleotide or protein sequences. It handles very large alignments (up to a million sequences) efficiently.

tools.name: FastDTLmapper
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-wide gene gain/loss mapping tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for mapping genome-wide gene gain and loss events using the Duplication-Transfer-Loss (DTL) reconciliation method, optimized for speed.

tools.name: beagle_optimiser
tools.one_line_profile: Optimizer for BEAGLE library settings in phylogenetic analysis
tools.detailed_description: A utility to find the optimal BEAGLE library configuration (CPU/GPU resources) for BEAST or MrBayes analyses to minimize execution time.

tools.name: TreeTime
tools.one_line_profile: Maximum likelihood inference of time-stamped phylogenies
tools.detailed_description: TreeTime provides routines for ancestral sequence reconstruction and inference of molecular-clock phylogenies, widely used for viral evolution analysis.

tools.name: SYNPHONI
tools.one_line_profile: Reconstruction of dynamic evolution of syntenic relationships
tools.detailed_description: A tool for reconstructing the dynamic evolution of syntenic relationships across phylogenetic distances, providing syntenic complements for ancestral nodes.

tools.name: Burntrees
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for manipulating phylogenetic MCMC output
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Perl scripts for processing and manipulating output files from phylogenetic MCMC software like MrBayes, BEAST, and PhyloBayes.

tools.name: catfasta2phyml
tools.one_line_profile: Concatenates FASTA files to PHYLIP format
tools.detailed_description: A script to concatenate multiple FASTA formatted sequence files into a single PHYLIP formatted file, commonly used for preparing phylogenomic datasets.

tools.name: SNVPhyl Galaxy
tools.one_line_profile: Whole genome phylogenomics pipeline (Galaxy wrapper)
tools.detailed_description: The Galaxy wrapper and workflow for the SNVPhyl pipeline, which performs whole genome phylogenomics analysis from raw reads to phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: SNVPhyl Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Helper tools for SNVPhyl phylogenomics pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts and tools used within the SNVPhyl pipeline for tasks such as filtering, alignment processing, and file manipulation.

tools.name: EPA-ng
tools.one_line_profile: Massively parallel phylogenetic placement
tools.detailed_description: EPA-ng is a tool for massively parallel phylogenetic placement of genetic sequences, optimized for high performance on modern hardware.

tools.name: THD
tools.one_line_profile: Time-scaled haplotypic density estimation
tools.detailed_description: An R implementation for Time-scaled Haplotypic Density (THD), used to estimate epidemic success and transmission dynamics from pathogen genetic data.

tools.name: speedemon
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST 2 package for species delimitation
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST 2 package designed for rapid species delimitation using genomic data.

tools.name: Orthoflow
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for phylogenetic inference of genome-scale datasets
tools.detailed_description: A workflow for phylogenetic inference from genome-scale datasets of protein-coding genes, automating orthology inference and tree building.

tools.name: splace
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to split, align and concatenate genes for phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to automate the process of splitting, aligning, and concatenating gene sequences for phylogenetic inference.

tools.name: phylociraptor
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid phylogenomic tree calculator pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A highly customizable and reproducible framework for phylogenomic inference, designed to streamline the calculation of phylogenetic trees from genomic data.

tools.name: beautier
tools.one_line_profile: R package to generate BEAST2 XML parameter files
tools.detailed_description: An R package that allows users to generate BEAST2 XML parameter files programmatically, replicating the functionality of the BEAUti GUI.

tools.name: astral (Python)
tools.one_line_profile: Calculations for the position of the sun and moon
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for calculating the position of the sun and moon, as well as sunrise, sunset, and other solar phases, widely used in astronomical and environmental research.

tools.name: Extract_Consensus_Sequences_of_Genes_from_BAM_parallel
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for consensus sequence extraction and tree construction
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts for the rapid construction of target interval consensus sequences from BAM files and subsequent phylogenetic tree construction and visualization.

tools.name: astral (Go)
tools.one_line_profile: Go calculations for the position of the sun and moon
tools.detailed_description: A Go port of the python astral library, providing calculations for the position of the sun and moon.

tools.name: phylotoast
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for phylogenetic data analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools for phylogenetic data analysis, including visualization utilities and support for cluster computing, often used with QIIME.

tools.name: ASTRAL
tools.one_line_profile: Accurate Species Tree Algorithm for large datasets
tools.detailed_description: ASTRAL is a tool for estimating a species tree from a set of unrooted gene trees. It is statistically consistent under the multi-species coalescent model and efficient for large datasets.

tools.name: CherryML
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable maximum likelihood estimation of phylogenetic models
tools.detailed_description: CherryML provides scalable maximum likelihood estimation for phylogenetic models, enabling efficient analysis of large-scale evolutionary data.

tools.name: ALE
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic reconciliation of gene trees and species trees using Amalgamated Likelihood Estimation
tools.detailed_description: ALE (Amalgamated Likelihood Estimation) is a probabilistic approach to exhaustively explore all reconciled gene trees that can be amalgamated as a combination of clades observed in a sample of gene trees. It implements a reconciliation model allowing for duplication, transfer, and loss (DTL) of genes to estimate joint likelihoods and infer reconciled gene trees.

tools.name: ExaML
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale Maximum Likelihood code for phylogenetic inference using MPI
tools.detailed_description: ExaML (Exascale Maximum Likelihood) is a code for phylogenetic inference using the Maximum Likelihood method, specifically designed for large-scale datasets and high-performance computing environments using MPI (Message Passing Interface). It serves as a dedicated tool for massive phylogenetic tree reconstruction.

tools.name: unicore
tools.one_line_profile: Structure-based core gene phylogeny inference tool
tools.detailed_description: Unicore is a tool for generating universal and efficient structure-based core gene phylogenies. It leverages Foldseek and ProstT5 to utilize protein structure information for phylogenetic inference, offering an alternative to sequence-based methods for deep evolutionary relationships.

tools.name: PhyML
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic estimation using Maximum Likelihood
tools.detailed_description: PhyML is a widely used software package for phylogenetic estimation using the Maximum Likelihood principle. It provides a range of evolutionary models and algorithms to estimate tree topologies and branch lengths from DNA or protein sequences.

tools.name: MBASR
tools.one_line_profile: Ancestral state reconstruction analysis using MrBayes output in R
tools.detailed_description: MBASR (MrBayes Ancestral States with R) is an R package designed to process, analyze, and visualize ancestral state reconstruction data generated by the phylogenetic software MrBayes.

tools.name: aPhyloGeo-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogeographic analysis workflow using sliding windows
tools.detailed_description: aPhyloGeo-pipeline is a phylogeographic workflow that utilizes sliding-window analysis combined with RAxML-NG and FastTree to infer phylogenetic relationships and geographic patterns across genomic regions.

tools.name: BDMM-Prime
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-type birth-death-sampling modelling package for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: BDMM-Prime is a package for the BEAST 2 phylogenetic software platform that implements multi-type birth-death-sampling models, allowing for the inference of population dynamics and structure from phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: MultiTypeTree
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST 2 package for structured population phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: MultiTypeTree is a BEAST 2 package that provides support for inferring phylogenetic trees on structured populations (multi-type trees), enabling the analysis of migration and population structure alongside phylogeny.

tools.name: bacter
tools.one_line_profile: Bacterial phylogenetics package for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: Bacter is a BEAST 2 package specifically designed for bacterial phylogenetics, addressing the specific evolutionary models and challenges associated with bacterial genomic data inference.

tools.name: feast
tools.one_line_profile: Utility collection for BEAST 2 phylogenetic analysis
tools.detailed_description: Feast provides a collection of miscellaneous tools and model components for the BEAST 2 phylogenetic software, enhancing its capabilities for various evolutionary analyses.

tools.name: remaster
tools.one_line_profile: High-fidelity stochastic tree simulation for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: Remaster is a BEAST 2 package for performing high-fidelity stochastic simulations of phylogenetic trees, useful for validating models and generating synthetic data for evolutionary studies.

tools.name: conifer
tools.one_line_profile: FPGA-accelerated Boosted Decision Tree inference for physics
tools.detailed_description: Conifer is a library for fast inference of Boosted Decision Trees (BDTs) on FPGAs, primarily used in High Energy Physics (HEP) for trigger systems and real-time data analysis.

tools.name: tskit
tools.one_line_profile: Population-scale Ancestral Recombination Graph (ARG) library
tools.detailed_description: tskit is a library for defining, storing, and processing large-scale genetic genealogies (tree sequences). It provides efficient methods for population genetics simulations and analysis of Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs).

tools.name: get_phylomarkers
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for optimal phylogenomic marker selection
tools.detailed_description: get_phylomarkers is a pipeline designed to select optimal markers for microbial phylogenomics and species tree estimation. It supports both multispecies coalescent and concatenation approaches for phylogenetic inference.

tools.name: macroTraits
tools.one_line_profile: R functions for macroecological and phylogenetic trait analysis
tools.detailed_description: macroTraits is a set of R functions to test trait correlations, phylogenetic constraints, and spatial variability at large scales, facilitating macroecological and evolutionary research.

tools.name: AMPHORA2
tools.one_line_profile: Automated phylogenomic inference pipeline for bacteria and archaea
tools.detailed_description: AMPHORA2 is an automated pipeline for phylogenomic inference from bacterial and archaeal protein sequences. It identifies phylogenetic markers and constructs trees for taxonomic analysis.

tools.name: Phyla_AMPHORA
tools.one_line_profile: Phylum-specific automated phylogenomic inference pipeline
tools.detailed_description: Phyla_AMPHORA is a specialized version of the AMPHORA pipeline, designed for phylum-specific automated phylogenomic inference using bacterial sequences.

tools.name: sitePath
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic pathway-dependent mutation analysis
tools.detailed_description: sitePath is an R package for phylogenetic pathway-dependent recognition of fixed substitutions and parallel mutations. It helps in analyzing molecular evolution by tracing site-specific changes across phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: VEHoP
tools.one_line_profile: Versatile Homology-based Phylogenomic pipeline
tools.detailed_description: VEHoP (Versatile and Easy-to-use Homology-based Phylogenomic pipeline) is a tool designed to accommodate diverse data types (DNA, RNA, and protein sequences) for homology-based phylogenomic analysis.

tools.name: buscophylo
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-scale phylogenetic analysis workflow
tools.detailed_description: buscophylo is a custom workflow designed for conducting genome-scale phylogenetic analysis, likely integrating BUSCO results for tree reconstruction.

tools.name: phytop
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of ASTRAL species trees with gene tree discordance
tools.detailed_description: phytop is a Python tool for visualizing species trees generated by ASTRAL, specifically highlighting gene tree discordance to aid in interpreting phylogenetic conflicts.

tools.name: SynNet-Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for building microsynteny networks
tools.detailed_description: SynNet-Pipeline is a workflow designed for building microsynteny networks, facilitating comparative genomics and evolutionary analysis of gene order conservation.
